page.title: 14LOCAL PUBLICATIONS
page.content: The{Westmorland Gazette,}based in Kendal,was established in{1818}and over{8,500}issues have been published since, on a weekly basis. The paper is divided into{2 sections the first concerning news while the second half is mainly advertisements and local information. The Gazette comprises of these news articles along with a W.I. page and a farming supplement. There is also a letter page, nature column, sports page and engagements etc. In the second section of the Gazette one can read about houses and {miscellaneous items for sale.}There is also information about opening times for shops : Hospital visiting hours : Weekend television and the Junior G Club for its younger readers. There is also another paper called The Lakeland Echo, which is free.
